attributes.comment:
I am writing to implore the officials considering raising USCIS fees associated
with international adoption to please veto the proposed changes. The people
that will be adversely affected by these changes are those who most desperately
need our help and the opportunities that being a US citizen affords: orphaned
children around the world. The families that would be affected by these changes
already face an enormous burden of paying for adoption and adding to their
families, and to increase the burden strikes me as patently unfair to all involved.

I understand that costs rise over time, but a 66% increase affecting adoption
alone and not other areas of immigration and naturalization seems extreme and as
though someone is merely interested in making it harder for young,
underprivileged children to find loving American families and experience the
amazing opportunities that becoming an American gives them.

Please do not institute this fee increase and thereby penalize families who are
opening their arms and hearts to those who have less than nothing. As an
adoptive parent, I can tell you that this would hurt us as a family more than
you might expect and truly limit how we can continue to build our family in the
future.

Sincerely,
Mrs. Suzanne Talbert
Dexter, MI.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Suzanne Talbert
